info.title: Voucherify API - Publications
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details. - Endpoints tagged with 'Publications'

get.description:
This method selects vouchers that are suitable for publication, adds a publish entry and returns the publication.

A voucher is suitable for publication when it's active and hasn't been published yet.
> â—ï¸ Limited access
>
> Access to this endpoint is limited. This endpoint is designed for specific integrations and the API keys need to be configured to access this endpoint. Navigate to the **Dashboard** → **Project Settings** → **General** → **Integration Keys** to set up a pair of API keys and use them to send the request.  

<!-- theme: warning -->
> ðŸš§ Clearly define the source of the voucher
>
> You must clearly define which source you want to publish the voucher code from. It can either be a code from a campaign or a specific voucher identified by a code.  
<!-- theme: warning -->
> ðŸš§ Publish multiple vouchers
> This endpoint does not support the publishing of multiple vouchers from a single campaign. In case you want to publish multiple vouchers within a single publication, you need to use a [dedicated endpoint](ref:create-publication).  

<!-- theme: info -->

> ðŸ“˜ Auto-update campaign
>
> In case you want to ensure the number of publishable codes increases automatically with the number of customers, you should use an **auto-update** campaign.  

## Example Request 
```markdown Publication Query 
/publications/create?campaign[name]=BlackFriday&customer[source_id]=Customer_Source_ID 
```  

<!-- theme: danger -->
> â—ï¸ Required  
>
> Query param `voucher` OR `campaign` MUST be filled out. If you provide both, `campaign` param will be skipped.

parameters.name: join_once
parameters.description: Through this flag, you can control if a particular person gets only one and always the same code even if the app sends multiple publication requests. It means that if you have a referral program, a referrer is assigned only to one code if an integration sends publication requests more than once for the same customer.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description:
The merchant's publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.
If `source_id` is provided only 1 voucher can be published per request.

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: Contains information about the customer to whom the publication was directed.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

400.description: Returns an error if the query parameters are incomplete.

value.details: Either Campaign or Voucher is required
Voucher cannot be published. Customer already joined program.
Only up to 1 can be published
ImageURL: must be a URL pointing to JPG/JPEG or PNG resource (actual value is 'http.com')

403.description: Returns an error if you don't have a specific credentials set up. Navigate to the **Dashboard** → **Project Settings** → **General** → **Integration Keys** to set up a pair of API keys and use them to send the request.

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

value.details: Cannot find customer with id cust_xqA7DGj5eYPHg6PHVKwYRWiA

get.description:
Retrieve a list of publications. To return a **particular** publication, you can use the `source_id` query parameter and provide the `source_id` of the publication you are looking for specifically.

## Pagination

<!-- theme: warning -->
> ðŸš§ Important!
>
> If you want to scroll through a huge set of records, it is recommended to use the <!-- [Exports API](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/16_obj_export_object) -->[Exports API](ref:create-export). This API will return an error `page_over_limit` if you reach a page above 1000.

## Filter Query

The `filters` query parameter allows for joining multiple parameters with logical operators. The syntax looks as follows:

<!--
title: "Filter template"
-->
```url
filters[<field_name>][conditions][<operator>][<index>]=<value>
```

### Operators:

<!--
title: "Operators"
-->
```
    "$in"
    "$not_in"
    "$is"
    "$is_not"
    "$has_value"
    "$is_unknown"
    "$contains"
    "$starts_with"
    "$ends_with"
    "$more_than"
    "$less_than"
    "$more_than_equal"
    "$less_than_equal"
```

### Examples

<!--
title: "Example 1 - List publications of a given customer"
-->
```url
GET /v1/publications?filters[customer_id][conditions][$is][0]=cust_lUET6gRpO5Wxlg5p2j2gRCgL
```
<!--
title: "Example 2 - List publications of 2 customers"
-->
```url
GET /v1/publications?filters[customer_id][conditions][$in][0]=cust_lUET6gRpO5Wxlg5p2j2gRCgL&filters[customer_id][conditions][$in][1]=cust_aR7NfHusxT7PdTMAKMfWDXnc
```
<!--
title: "Example 3 - List publications of 2 customers using junction operator"
-->
```url
GET /v1/publications?filters[customer_id][conditions][$is][0]=cust_lUET6gRpO5Wxlg5p2j2gRCgL&filters[customer_id][conditions][$is][1]=cust_aR7NfHusxT7PdTMAKMfWDXnc&filters[junction]=OR
```

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash `-` preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

parameters.name: campaign
parameters.description: Filters by a given campaign name.

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: Filters by a unique customer ID.

parameters.name: voucher
parameters.description: Filters by a given voucher code.

parameters.name: is_referral_code
parameters.description: This filter works only for the `true` option. If set to `true`, the query returns only publications of codes from referral campaigns.

parameters.name: source_id
parameters.description: Using this endpoint with a particular publication `source_id`, which was sent with the original request to create a publication, returns in the response, exactly the same code published initially because the code was assigned to the given publication. As a result, you can use this endpoint as a reference and return a code that was assigned in a publication by using a particular `source_id`.

200.description: Returns a list of publications you've previously created with <!-- [create publication](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1publications/post) -->[create publication](ref:create-publication) or implicitly by the distribution manager. The publications are returned in sorted order, with the most recent ones appearing first.

400.description: Returns an error if you request a page higher than 1000.

value.message: Listing resource above 1000 page is not supported

post.description:
This method selects vouchers that are suitable for publication, adds a publish entry and returns the publication.

A voucher is suitable for publication when it's active and hasn't been published yet.  

<!-- theme: warning -->
> ðŸš§ Clearly define the source of the voucher
>
> You must clearly define which source you want to publish the voucher code from. It can either be a code from a campaign or a specific voucher identified by a code.  
<!-- theme: warning -->
> ðŸš§ Publish multiple vouchers
> In case you want to publish multiple vouchers within a single publication, you need to specify the campaign name and number of vouchers you want to publish.  
<!-- theme: info -->

> ðŸ“˜ Auto-update campaign
>
> In case you want to ensure the number of publishable codes increases automatically with the number of customers, you should use an **auto-update** campaign.

parameters.name: join_once
parameters.description: Through this flag, you can control if a particular person gets only one and always the same code even if the app sends multiple publication requests. It means that if you have a referral program, a referrer is assigned only to one code if an integration sends publication requests more than once for the same customer.

200.description: Returns a publication object if a valid identifier was provided.

400.description: Returns an error if a publication with the same source ID already exists in the system or some request body parameter is missing.

value.details: Either Campaign or Voucher is required

404.description: Returns an error if a resource is not found.

name.description: Name of voucher's parent campaign or unique campaign ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

count.description: Number of vouchers to be published to customer.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

resource_id.description: Unique resource ID that can be used in another endpoint to get more details.

error.description: Includes additional information about the error.

message.description: The message configured by the user in a validation rule.
A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

is_referral_code.description: Filter publications by is referall code.

parent_object_id.description: Filter publications by parent object id.

related_object_id.description: Filter publications by related object id.

PublicationsListResponseBody.description: Response body schema for listing publications using **GET** `v1/publications`.
PublicationsListResponseBody.title: Publications List Response Body

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about publications in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of publications.

publications.description: Contains array of publication objects, voucher object will be simplified.

items.title: Publications List Response Body Publications Item
items.description: Response schema model for publishing vouchers to a specific customer.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

vouchers.description: Contains the unique voucher codes that was assigned by Voucherify.

Junction.title: Junction
Junction.description: Logical Operator Between Filters. Filter by conditions set on the `junction` parameter indicating how the `conditions` should be accounted for in the query. An `AND` is an all-inclusive logical operator, meaning the `AND` operator displays a record if **ALL** the conditions separated by AND are TRUE, while  an `OR` operator displays a record if **ANY** of the conditions separated by OR is TRUE.

FilterConditionsString.title: Filter by conditions
FilterConditionsString.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

$not_contain.description: Value does NOT include the specified string.

vouchers.description: Contains the unique voucher codes that was assigned by Voucherify.

failure_code.description: Generic reason as to why the create publication operation failed.

failure_message.description: This parameter will provide more expanded reason as to why the create publication operation failed.

voucher.description: Code of the voucher being published.

id.description: Unique publication ID, assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `publication`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the publication was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer receiving the publication.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

channel.description: How the publication was originated. It can be your own custom channel or an example value provided here.

source_id.description: The merchant's publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

vouchers_id.description: Contains the unique internal voucher ID that was assigned by Voucherify.

Voucher.title: Voucher
Voucher.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories and validation rules assignments.

id.description: Unique publication ID, assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `publication`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the publication was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer receiving the publication.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

source_type.description: Defines the type of the distribution source.

source_id.description: Unique identifier of the distribution source.

channel.description: How the publication was originated. It can be your own custom channel or an example value provided here.

source_id.description: The merchant's publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

vouchers.description: Contains the voucher IDs that was assigned by Voucherify.

vouchers_id.description: Contains the unique internal voucher IDs that was assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

source_id.description:
The merchant's publication ID if it is different from the Voucherify publication ID. It's an optional tracking identifier of a publication. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a publication ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.
If `source_id` is provided only 1 voucher can be published per request.

customer.description: Contains information about the customer to whom the publication was directed.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the publication. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a publication object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the publication in a structured format.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption in this request.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

system_metadata.description: Object used to store system metadata information.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

assets.description: Contains information about the customer's cockpit.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

VoucherBase.title: Voucher Base
VoucherBase.description: This is an object representing a voucher.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

Category.title: Category
Category.description: This is an object representing a category.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about validation rules assignments.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rules assignments.

data.description: Contains array of validation rules assignments.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assignments.

Gift.title: Gift
Gift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`. `balance` = `amount` - `subtracted_amount` - `redemption.redeemed_amount`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

points.description: Customer's loyalty points minus expired for all loyalty cards which the customer has.

referred_customers.description: Total number of customers referred by the customer.

campaigns.description: Contains campaigns with details about point balances and how many customers were referred by the customer.

additionalProperties.description: Contains details about the point balances left on loyalty cards and the number of referred customers in each campaign.

loyalty_tier.description: Customer's loyalty tier within the campaign.

referred_customers.description: Number of customers referred by the customer in campaign.

CustomerReferrals.title: Customer Referrals
CustomerReferrals.description: Summary of customer's referrals, in this case, the customer being the referee, i.e. information about the source of referrals and number of times the customer was referred by other customers.

total.description: Total number of times this customer received a referral, i.e. was referred by another customer.

campaigns.description: Contains an array of campaigns that served as the source of a referral for the customer.

items.title: Customer Referrals Campaigns Item
items.description: Contains information about the source of the referral.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID, assigned by Voucherify. This is the customer ID of a customer that is referring this customer.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was referred in ISO 8601 format.

ValidityTimeframe.title: Validity Timeframe
ValidityTimeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

ValidityDayOfWeek.title: Validity Day Of Week
ValidityDayOfWeek.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

ValidityHours.title: Validity Hours
ValidityHours.description: Determines the hours of validity, e.g. to create a happy hours scenario.

daily.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource is active. The periods should not overlap.

items.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource will be active.

start_time.description: Defines the starting hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive before* this time.

days_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the resource is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3`  Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

expiration_time.description: Defines the ending hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive after* this time.

VoucherAssets.title: Voucher Assets
VoucherAssets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

id.description: The unique identifier for a assignment

rule_id.description: The unique identifier for a rule

related_object_id.description: The unique identifier for a related object

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

validation_status.description: The validation status of the assignment

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

total_redeemed.description: Total number of redemptions made by the customer.

total_failed.description: Total number of redemptions that failed.

total_succeeded.description: Total number of redemptions that succeeded.

total_rolled_back.description: Total number of redemptions that were rolled back for the customer.

total_rollback_failed.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that failed.

total_rollback_succeeded.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that succeeded.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount of gift card credits redeemed by customer. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

amount_to_go.description: Remaining gift card balance across all gift cards. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

redeemed_points.description: Total number of loyalty points redeemed by the customer.

points_to_go.description: Sum of remaining available point balance across all loyalty cards.

CustomerSummaryOrders.title: Customer Summary Orders
CustomerSummaryOrders.description: Lists details about orders related to the customer. Lists only data for orders with the `PAID` or `FULFILLED` status. Data from orders with a `CREATED` or `CANCELED` status are not included. The data is updated also when an order changes status.

total_amount.description: The total amount spent by the customer. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

total_count.description: Total number of orders made by the customer.

average_amount.description: Average amount spent on orders. `total_amount` ÷ `total_count`. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

last_order_amount.description: Amount spent on last order. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

last_order_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time of the customer's last order in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.
Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of objects to be returned. The limit can range between 1 and 100 items. If no limit is set, it returns 10 items.

page.name: page
page.description: Which page of results to return. The lowest value is `1`.

scopes.api: Gives access to whole server-side API.
scopes.vouchers: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `v1/vouchers`.
scopes.client_api: Gives access to whole client-side API.
scopes.client_vouchers: Gives access to all endpoints and methods starting with `/client/v1/vouchers`.
